Just to be clear:
There is no Virus here!

I admit I should have included the following in the description, so that you can check for yourself.
Here are links to scans with Jottis Malwarescanner and novirusthanks.org:
see the results for yourself and decide whether there is a virus or not.
http://vscan.novirusthanks.org/analysis/b6ac9256dc2c68751facf49b48ffe16e/cGhvdG9zaG9wY3M1ZXh0ZW5kZWQtZWRpdGlvbi1r/
Note that even if it says "infected" it shows under "results": Crack.EC, Riskware.Keygen.Adobe!IK, CRCK_KEYGEN.
http://virusscan.jotti.org/de/scanresult/b7595fcbc435f190268aacaecf60a296b8a67af7/9ba1f007d1407229ed17aff27619df7eb1413c39
Jottis Malewarescanner shows with Quickheal and Sophos a Trojan:
That is what is called a "false positive".
If you don't know what that is and still think it's too risky, JUST DON'T DOWNLOAD!

Thanks for the attempt to make it userfriendly but the hosts file can't be edited on Windows 7 even if you are an administrator, unless you first start notepad to run it in administrator mode, then open hosts.txt. It's hidden so you need to type in the name manually (how is a n00b supposed to know that do you think?). I work as a support technician and even I didn't know this.
Makes me wonder; why aren't there any crackers that are "uncool" (?) enough to make a turnkey release that works right out of the box, without lots of masturbation stuff such as serials, unrar, readmes, keygens, file editing and quirky instructions... I would actually be willing to pay for something like that.
I installed this for my girlfriend and had I known how much time it would take me to install I would not have attempted it. Tip: Crackers without anything to do; make a hosts.txt patching tool to include with your next release.

IMPORTANT HELP:

If you are getting a subscription error, search the web for a new serial. This keygenerator likes to generate subscription version serial numbers. Once you find a retail edition serial, it'll unlock just fine (assuming that you have blocked activation properly).
